title.narrative: 4.4 EDUCATION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Increased country-level capacities (Government and communities) to respond to emergencies are increased, with 120,000 children accessing education in emergency situations, including Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), host communities and returnees., which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the GER for primary school has increased by 9 per cent, ensuring safe, equitable and quality education, with improved learning outcomes for learners at pre-primary, primary and secondary levels, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, especially girls, populations and geographic areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased country-level capacities (Government and communities) to respond to emergencies are increased, with 120,000 childrenaccessing education in emergency situations, including IDPs, host communities and returnees.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the three MoEs in the development of the COVID-19 Education Response? and the Safe-School re-opening plans. A total of 141,816 children (42% girls) in primary grades accessed formal education, and life skills-based distance learning, disseminated through TV, radios and online platforms. Across Africa, Puntland leads by adopting the Learning Passport (a digital learning platform). Across the country, 64,840 crisis-affected children (46% girls) benefitted from a comprehensive education package. Additionally, 776 teachers (26% female) were trained in pedagogic skills and psychosocial support and provided a monthly incentive, which assisted to retain a trained and motivated teaching workforce. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2020
